title: What Is at the Zoo?
subtle: Informational (nonfiction), 76 words, Level C (Grade K), Lexile 130L
description: What Is at the Zoo? introduces students to the interrogative sentence form by asking them which animals are at the zoo. Although students may wish it were so, the last animal isn't seen in zoos these days. Pictures support early readers.
reviewWords: bears, dinosaurs, elephants, giraffes, lions, monkeys, sea lions, tigers, zoo
comprehension: Main Idea and Details                : Identify main idea and details
grammar: Sentence Types                : Recognize declarative and interrogative sentences
